ygData.subject: Re: Just a rant, nothing important
ygData.msgSnippet: Just to contribute--- I got tired of reaching across the keyboard from where the arrow keys are, so I set-up my HotKeys/Keyboard Config, such that on the
ygData.messageBody:
Just to contribute---

I got tired of reaching across the keyboard from where the arrow keys are,
so I set-up my HotKeys/Keyboard Config, such that on the NUMPAD, 1 thru 5
are group members 1 to 5, 0 is TARGET NEAREST NPC, ENTER is the Healing
Spell I am currently using, and the other buttons demical, + sign, etc,
becomce misc things, such as Root, some DD, Assist or whatever.

Just my 2cp

----- Original Message -----
From: Anne O <topaaz1@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, December 10, 1999 8:53 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Just a rant, nothing important


> From: "Anne O" <topaaz1@...>
>
> um what i do is plain and simple
> all my spells are on my hot keys
> i target the group member useing f1-f6
> hot key 1-whatever lessor heal i am useing
> hot key 2-shield
> hot key 3-DD
> hot key 4-buff
> hot key 5-undead if we are doing undead
> hot key 6-buff
> i have 8 spells on side like everyone and for 7th and 8th, one of them is
> always root and the other is alway my best heal(which i only use in case
of
> emergemcies or for my tanks when they are at 2 bubbs) i use the mouse but
my
> mouse is always sitting in that spot so i dont have to move it much in
any
> case i have never been acused of being a bad cleric, and i perfer the heal
> and med during fight method =0)
> Topaaz SpllBinder-The Society
> Xegony
>
>
> >From: "Jeff Portwine" <jdport@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> >To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> >Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Just a rant, nothing important
> >Date: Wed, 8 Dec 1999 16:52:10 -0500
> >
> >I also have my heal spells on hot-keys... usually i use
> >2 for my greater heal and 3 for regular heal. That way I don't have
> >to move the mouse... i hold the mouse over the life bars and just
> >click the name that needs a heal then hit 2 or 3... then you don't have
> >to move the mouse from one side of the screen all the way to the other...
> >it's very quick and easy.
> >
> >-Eachann Bronzeleaf
> >-Cleric of Tunare, Tarew Marr
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >
>
>
